summary: This is an email chain from July 29, 2020, discussing a media inquiry from Bloomberg reporter Patricia Hurtado regarding a legal filing by Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyers in a civil suit. The filing alleges prosecutors improperly obtained Maxwell's sealed deposition testimony and set a 'perjury trap' during her April 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her lawyers filed a motion alleging prosecutors improperly obtained her sealed deposition testimony and set a 'perjury trap' during her 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Patricia Hurtado
persons.context: A Bloomberg reporter inquiring about allegations made in a legal filing by Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyers.

persons.name: Judge Preska
persons.context: The judge presiding over the civil case referenced in the document (15-cv-7433).

connections.description: Judge Preska is presiding over the civil case in which Maxwell's lawyers filed the motion discussed.

events.title: Media Inquiry Regarding Maxwell Filing
events.description: Bloomberg reporter Patricia Hurtado sends an inquiry about a filing made by Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyers alleging prosecutorial misconduct.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition was taken in April 2016. Her lawyers now allege this was a 'perjury trap' set by lawyers working with the government.

events.title: Filing in Civil Suit
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyers file a motion (document 1078 in case 15-cv-7433) questioning how prosecutors obtained her sealed testimony and alleging a perjury trap.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyers filed a motion alleging prosecutors improperly obtained her sworn testimony which was supposed to be under seal.
The filing alleges that a 'perjury trap' was set for Maxwell during her deposition in April 2016.
The motion was filed in the civil case 15-cv-7433 before Judge Preska.
Bloomberg reporter Patricia Hurtado was seeking comment on these allegations in July 2020.
